column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

There was larger number of 258 trade and export cattle at Powranna on Tuesday with more cows and bulls included.

All cattle met a cheaper market with many averages 10c to 30c cheaper. The best yearling steers made 180c to 234c while the seconds made 170c to 180c/kg. Yearling heifers made 200c to 238c/kg.

Most grown steers and bullocks made 200c to 230c while crossbreds made 100c to 132c/kg.
There were approximately 130 cows and 30 bulls and the best cows made 160c to 200c and the seconds 130c to 170c. Heavy bulls made 120c to 140c/kg live weight.

Market Reporter Richard Bailey
